name: ppi

PPI noun [U]
(COMPUTER IMAGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also ppi) abbreviation for pixels per inch: a measure of the detail shown in a computer image or on a computer screen: Monitors typically had a resolution of between 92 and 125 PPI.
More examplesFewer examplesDrum scanners are capable of resolutions up to 12,000 PPI. Printed at 10 x 8, it drops to 150 ppi.The 160 PPI screen with LED back lighting is simply stunning.
PPI noun [U]
(INSURANCE)
abbreviation for payment protection insurance: a type of insurance that pays back a loan (= money that has been lent) if the person who borrowed money dies, becomes seriously ill, etc.: Thousands of people could have been missold PPI.
More examplesFewer examples The firm became authorised to sell PPI in May 2006.PPI attached to credit cards - with an average cost of £127.60 - could be worth £970m a year.The PPI market has been the subject of intense regulatory scrutiny.

ECONOMICS abbreviation for producer price index: a series of numbers used in the US to show changes in the price of goods made by US manufacturers: The PPI rose 0.5% last month after being flat in March.
